header: ORDER BELOW EX. NO. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLN. NO. 178/2019. (CNR No. MHPU01­000704 ­2019) Datta Pandurang Gurav / Shinde Vs. The State of Maharashtra (PSO Vadgaon Maval P.S.)

background.text: [1] This is a first bail application under Section 439 of Cr.P.C. for the grant of bail to Applicant – Datta Pandurang Gurav / Shinde for the offences punishable under Section 324, 323, 436, 452, 504 and 506 of I.P.C. in C.R. No. 3/2019 registered at Vadgaon Maval Police Station, District – Pune.

arguments.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record.

arguments.text: [3] Prosecution case in short is as under:­ That complainant is brother in law of accused. The accused & sister of complainant were undergoing matrimonial disputes. On 02.01.2019 at about 2.00 a.m. when complainant and his family members were sleeping in their house, at that accused suddenly came there and assaulted complainant and his wife with club, kicks and blows. At about 03.00 a.m. accused set ablaze the door of complainant by pouring kerosene. On these allegations, the accused was prosecuted.

argumentSentences.text: [3] Prosecution case in short is as under:­ That complainant is brother in law of accused.
The accused & sister of complainant were undergoing matrimonial disputes.

On 02.01.2019 at about 2.00 a.m. when complainant and his family members were sleeping in their house, at that accused suddenly came there and assaulted complainant and his wife with club, kicks and blows.
At about 03.00 a.m. accused set ablaze the door of complainant by pouring kerosene.
On these allegations, the accused was prosecuted.

arguments.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for the Applicant submitted that, the applicant is innocent and is falsely implicated in this crime. The accused/applicant was not present at the time of incident. The investigation is practically completed. There is no specific role attributed to the applicant. The applicant is having custody of his six years’s daughter from the inception of dispute with his wife. She wants the custody of her daughter and hence she along with her family members falsely implicated the applicant in present crime. He is ready to co­operate with the investigating agency. He is ready to abide all the terms and conditions, which will be imposed by the Court. On these grounds, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for the Applicant submitted that, the applicant is innocent and is falsely implicated in this crime.
The accused/applicant was not present at the time of incident.
The investigation is practically completed.
There is no specific role attributed to the applicant.
The applicant is having custody of his six years’s daughter from the inception of dispute with his wife.
She wants the custody of her daughter and hence she along with her family members falsely implicated the applicant in present crime.
He is ready to co­operate with the investigating agency.
He is ready to abide all the terms and conditions, which will be imposed by the Court.
On these grounds, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: [5] On the other hand, the Ld. APP submitted that, there is prima facie accusation against the applicant. If the applicant is released on bail, then he may tamper with the prosecution evidence. There is statement of eye­witnesses. It is submitted that, looking to the gravity of the offence, the application is liable to be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: [5] On the other hand, the Ld. APP submitted that, there is prima facie accusation against the applicant.
If the applicant is released on bail, then he may tamper with the prosecution evidence.
There is statement of eye­witnesses.
It is submitted that, looking to the gravity of the offence, the application is liable to be rejected.

arguments.text: [6] After considering this submission of both the sides and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that, there was a dispute between the accused and his wife. The applicant is in custody since 06.01.2019. The investigation is practically completed. The alleged offences are not punishable with life imprisonment. The applicant is permanent resident of Lonavala. He has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would be served by keeping the applicant in jail. He is ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court. Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, the applicant is entitled to be released on bail. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order

argumentSentences.text: [6] After considering this submission of both the sides and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that, there was a dispute between the accused and his wife.
The applicant is in custody since 06.01.2019.
The investigation is practically completed.
The alleged offences are not punishable with life imprisonment.
The applicant is permanent resident of Lonavala.
He has no criminal antecedents.
No purpose would be served by keeping the applicant in jail.
He is ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court.
Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, the applicant is entitled to be released on bail.
Hence, I proceed to pass the following order

order.text: ORDER [1] Application (Exh.1) is allowed. [2] Applicants/accused ­ Datta Pandurang Gurav / Shinde be released on bail for the offences punishable under Section 324, 323, 436, 452, 504 and 506 of I.P.C. in C.R. No. 3/2019 registered at Vadgaon Maval Police Station, District – Pune on executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ along with solvent surety of the like amount on the following conditions :­­ (a) he shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence. (b) he shall co­operate the investigation agency as and when required. (c) he shall attend the police station Vadgaon Maval, Pune on every Monday and Friday in between 11.00 a.m. to 01.00 p.m. till filing of charge­sheet. [3] He shall produce his Aadhar card, electricity bill and mobile number etc. to show his permanent place of residence, at the time of furnishing surety in the court. [4] Bail before remand Court.

footer: Sd/­ (G.P.Agrawal) Date : 18.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Mrs. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune. Order delivered on : 18/01/2019 Order signed on : 18/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 21/01/2019
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EX. NO. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLN. NO. 178/2019. (CNR No. MHPU01­000704 ­2019) Datta Pandurang Gurav / Shinde Vs. The State of Maharashtra (PSO Vadgaon Maval P.S.) 
---header-ends---
[1] This is a first bail application under Section 439 of Cr.P.C. for the grant of bail to Applicant – Datta Pandurang Gurav / Shinde for the offences punishable under Section 324, 323, 436, 452, 504 and 506 of I.P.C. in C.R. No. 3/2019 registered at Vadgaon Maval Police Station, District – Pune. 
---background-ends---
[2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record. 
---argument-ends---
[3] Prosecution case in short is as under:­ That complainant is brother in law of accused. The accused & sister of complainant were undergoing matrimonial disputes. On 02.01.2019 at about 2.00 a.m. when complainant and his family members were sleeping in their house, at that accused suddenly came there and assaulted complainant and his wife with club, kicks and blows. At about 03.00 a.m. accused set ablaze the door of complainant by pouring kerosene. On these allegations, the accused was prosecuted. 
---argument-ends---
[4] The Ld. Counsel for the Applicant submitted that, the applicant is innocent and is falsely implicated in this crime. The accused/applicant was not present at the time of incident. The investigation is practically completed. There is no specific role attributed to the applicant. The applicant is having custody of his six years’s daughter from the inception of dispute with his wife. She wants the custody of her daughter and hence she along with her family members falsely implicated the applicant in present crime. He is ready to co­operate with the investigating agency. He is ready to abide all the terms and conditions, which will be imposed by the Court. On these grounds, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
[5] On the other hand, the Ld. APP submitted that, there is prima facie accusation against the applicant. If the applicant is released on bail, then he may tamper with the prosecution evidence. There is statement of eye­witnesses. It is submitted that, looking to the gravity of the offence, the application is liable to be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
[6] After considering this submission of both the sides and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that, there was a dispute between the accused and his wife. The applicant is in custody since 06.01.2019. The investigation is practically completed. The alleged offences are not punishable with life imprisonment. The applicant is permanent resident of Lonavala. He has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would be served by keeping the applicant in jail. He is ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court. Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, the applicant is entitled to be released on bail. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] Application (Exh.1) is allowed. [2] Applicants/accused ­ Datta Pandurang Gurav / Shinde be released on bail for the offences punishable under Section 324, 323, 436, 452, 504 and 506 of I.P.C. in C.R. No. 3/2019 registered at Vadgaon Maval Police Station, District – Pune on executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ along with solvent surety of the like amount on the following conditions :­­ (a) he shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence. (b) he shall co­operate the investigation agency as and when required. (c) he shall attend the police station Vadgaon Maval, Pune on every Monday and Friday in between 11.00 a.m. to 01.00 p.m. till filing of charge­sheet. [3] He shall produce his Aadhar card, electricity bill and mobile number etc. to show his permanent place of residence, at the time of furnishing surety in the court. [4] Bail before remand Court. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ (G.P.Agrawal) Date : 18.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Mrs. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune. Order delivered on : 18/01/2019 Order signed on : 18/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 21/01/2019
